concept.title: Pipeline Constants
concept.shortdesc: A pipeline constant is a constant that you define for the pipeline and that you can use in any stage in the pipeline. Define a pipeline constant when you have a constant that you want to update easily or to use more than once.

conbody.p: pipeline propertiespipeline constantsconstantspipeline constantspipeline constantsoverviewFor example, if you have a bonus percentage that you update quarterly, you might create a Bonus constant so you can update the value easily in the pipeline properties and have the value propagated throughout the pipeline. Or, if you use a common root directory that you use for source files and error files, you might create a Root constant that you use as a basis for both directories, e.g. Root/log and Root/error.
You can enter any text as the value for a pipeline constant. When the pipeline runs, the value replaces the name of the pipeline constant.
